com.halseyburgund.rwframework.core
Class RWLocationTracker

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      com.halseyburgund.rwframework.core.RWLocationTracker

public class RWLocationTracker
extends java.util.Observable

Singleton class providing GPS/Location functionality. It extends Observable so it can be observed to get updates on location changes. For testing purposes, amongst others, it can be fixed at a specific location.

For this singleton class you need to call the init method first, and then can call the startLocationUpdates method to active the updates. Use the stopLocationUpdates to cancel the updates (and save the battery).

Author:
Rob Knapen

Method Detail

instance

public static RWLocationTracker instance()
Accesses the singleton instance.

Returns:
singleton instance of the class

isUsingFixedLocation

public boolean isUsingFixedLocation()
Checks if a fixed location has been set for the location tracker. When set all location updates will be ignored.

Returns:
true is a fixed location is set

fixLocationAt

public void fixLocationAt(java.lang.Double latitude,
                          java.lang.Double longitude)
Sets the specified fixed location for the location tracker. Location updates will be ignored until the fixed location is released again.

Parameters:
latitude - of the fixed location
longitude - of the fixed location

fixLocationAt

public void fixLocationAt(Location location)
Sets the specified fixed location for the location tracker. Location updates will be ignored until the fixed location is released again.

Parameters:
location - to use as fixed location

releaseFixedLocation

public void releaseFixedLocation()
Releases the fixed location and returns to using regular location updates.

isGpsEnabled

public boolean isGpsEnabled()
Checks if the GPS is enabled and available on the device.

Returns:
true when GPS is available

isNetworkLocationEnabled

public boolean isNetworkLocationEnabled()
Checks if the Network location provider is enabled on the device.

Returns:
true when Network location is available

init

public boolean init(Context context)
Initializes the singleton instance for the specified context. This context is used to access the location providers. The method checks if at least one location provider is available and returns true if it is, false otherwise (no location data available).

Parameters:
context - to be used
Returns:
true if successful and a location provider is available

getLocationProviders

public boolean getLocationProviders()
Collects information about the available location providers on the device, and stores it in instance variables.

Returns:
true if at least one location provider is available

getLastLocation

public Location getLastLocation()
Gets the last known location information. Note that this is not Necessarily up-to-date.

Returns:
Location with last know position

gotoLastKnownLocation

public void gotoLastKnownLocation()
Accesses the most accurate available location provider on the device to get its last know position and uses it to set the internal state.

startLocationUpdates

public void startLocationUpdates(long minTime,
                                 float minDistance)
Starts receiving location updates from the devices' location providers. Initially the Network location will be used and a listener started to wait for GPS availability and first coordinate fix, which then will be switched to.

Parameters:
minTime - (msec) allowed between location updates
minDistance - (m) for location updates

swithToGpsLocationUpdates

public void swithToGpsLocationUpdates()
Switches from using Network location updates to GPS location updates.

switchToCoarseLocationUpdates

public void switchToCoarseLocationUpdates()
Switches from using GPS location updates to Network location updates.

stopLocationUpdates

public void stopLocationUpdates()
Stops receiving location updates. Call this method when location info is no longer needed, to reduce power consumption.
